author: dp_specialist
content:
Can someone explain this to me?. I found in the link below a comment that says

> Why does the contract at address 1 not have any source code? etherscan.io/address/0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000001 is the source published somewhere? 

and the answer is 

> They don't have EVM bytecode: their source code is in the clients themselves, for example Geth

How come a precompiled smart contract don't have bytecode? are they not executed in the EVM?

In appendix E of the yellow paper it seems that all precompiles have a predefined gas cost denoted with g_r. Is that right?

So, in my understanding is that for precompiles the gas is not defined for each opcode but for each contract as a whole. Is this correct?

https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/15479/list-of-pre-compiled-contracts

author: advaitasaha
content:
As per my understanding

Precompiles do not execute inside a smart contract, they are part of the Ethereum client specification.
You can see here : https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/core/vm/contracts.go#L81

And Yes gas is not defined for opcodes in case of pre-compiled

author: mason.mind
content: Hi all, I would like to share our latest work on FHE-DKSAP: Fully Homomorphic Encryption based Dual Key Stealth Address Protocol, which is an improvement proposal for EIP-5564 to improve security level and usablity. Any feedback is welcome! https://ethresear.ch/t/fhe-dksap-fully-homomorphic-encryption-based-dual-key-stealth-address-protocol/16213
